body:
First thing first, for text generation, you will need past_key_values for longer sequence. Are you able to export T5 model with past_key_values? If so, feel free to contribute your export script to help others.

We have some initial work on T5, which can be found in branch [here](https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/tree/yufeng/benchmark_t5/onnxruntime/python/tools/transformers/t5)
It does not support past_key_values yet but you can try the benchmark_t5 tool. 

For example, in my machine (xps tower 8930), ORT is faster than PyTorch in longer sequence:
```
python benchmark_t5.py -m t5-base -o --test_times 10 -p fp32 -b 3 --sequence_lengths 64 128 256 512 -s 0

PyTorch Version:1.7.0
Transformers Version:4.1.1
Onnxruntime Version:1.5.2
model=decoder, batch_size=3, sequence_length=64, past_sequence_length=0, torch_latency=252.50, onnxruntime_latency=183.60, onnxruntime_io_binding_latency=164.90
model=decoder, batch_size=3, sequence_length=128, past_sequence_length=0, torch_latency=710.30, onnxruntime_latency=361.20, onnxruntime_io_binding_latency=363.50
model=decoder, batch_size=3, sequence_length=256, past_sequence_length=0, torch_latency=1478.50, onnxruntime_latency=934.40, onnxruntime_io_binding_latency=877.20
model=decoder, batch_size=3, sequence_length=512, past_sequence_length=0, torch_latency=3680.30, onnxruntime_latency=2211.40, onnxruntime_io_binding_latency=2054.70
```

Actually, we have not started graph optimization (or any optimized kernel) for T5 model yet. We do have plan to improve T5 inference in near future (3~6 months). Please stay tuned.

BTW, you can use default SessionOptions and no need to change execution_mode or intra_op_num_threads (unless you tested that new setting is better).

hey, @tianleiwu thank you for the response. Yes, the t5 model utilizes `past_key_values`. I've optimized the inference code, now it does not slow down as much as it did before (for long sequence length and large batch size ). I'll be open-sourcing my project soon, please have a look at it.
for me, these following options are giving the best result so far... on Colab.
```
options.graph_optimization_level = GraphOptimizationLevel.ORT_ENABLE_ALL
options.execution_mode = ExecutionMode.ORT_PARALLEL 
options.intra_op_num_threads = 1
```
@Ki6an, thanks for sharing. I'm glad that you solved the issue. Looking forward to your solution.

@tianleiwu I finally open-sourced the [project](https://github.com/Ki6an/fastT5) & it's also available on [PyPI](https://pypi.org/project/fastt5/). Testing and publishing to PyPI took a little time. 

however, before exporting t5 to onnx with `past_key_values`. you need to fix two things :

- exporting has some issues in the transformer library which can be fixed by following the guide in this [notebook](https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1HuH1Ui3pCBS22hW4djIOyUBP5UW93705?usp=sharing). I've created a pull request for this fix [here](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/pull/10651), hope they merge it with the main branch soon. if you apply this fix you'll be able to use the fastT5 library without any problem.

- exporting has some bugs with` torch 1.8.0`, I've tested it many times, and exporting works fine on `torch 1.7.0 `. reported this bug [here ](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/53730)

by making sure of these things, with onnx models, I was able to get the inference speed boost of up to 5x. thanks to you guys for the amazing work on onnxruntime. 

please have look at the [fastT5 ](https://github.com/Ki6an/fastT5)library, I'd love to hear any feedback.

@Ki6an, cool! Thanks for your effort in making it possible to export t5 to onnx with past_key_values. That resolved a major issue for onnxruntime users to get faster inference of t5 model. 

A potential improvement for fastT5 in GPU is to use [IO Binding](https://www.onnxruntime.ai/python/api_summary). That avoid copying tensors (like past_key_values) from GPU to CPU, and reduce latency significantly.

@tianleiwu thank you.  I agree and also the implementation of  `beam search` and `greedy search`  for the onnx model, I went through several iterations until I found the simple solution. 

for GPU, I tried without the `io binding` but was not getting better results so just stuck to the CPU version & `onnxrutime-gpu` does not support quantization. potentially in the future might work on the GPU version of fastt5.

>we have not started graph optimization (or any optimized kernel) for T5 model yet. We do have plan to improve T5 inference in near future (3~6 months)

- how does the graph & kernel optimization work? 
- how can I contribute to onnxruntime for t5?
Hi @tianleiwu , Sorry to revive an old thread, but I have the same questions as @Ki6an ...

Regarding to graph & kernel optimization, there is developer guide:
https://github.com/microsoft/onnxruntime/blob/master/onnxruntime/python/tools/transformers/Dev_Guide.md

Currently, there are two operators are related to T5 optimization:
**DecoderAttention**: current logic is for Bart model, need add slight modification for T5.
**BeamSearch**: current logic is for GPT-2 model, need some change for T5.
